item.description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Accra, which elegantly stretches along the Atlantic coast of Ghana, is the country’s capital and largest city, with an estimated urbanpopulation of 2.3 million.
Originally built around a port, it served the capital of the British Gold Coast between 1877 and 1957. Accra has since transitioned into a modern, growing metropolis, the city reflects a history ranging from the 19th century architecture to modern skyscrapers and apartment blocks.
Accra is the home to the Kotoka International Airport and is your gateway to original Ghanaian hospitality, peace and joie de vivre! Accra is also home to many restaurants and “chop bars”, where you can sample authentic, divine-tasting Ghanaian and continental dishes. The city is vibrant and serves as Ghana’s economic, administrative, cultural and entertainment hub. The world famous Azonto dance, among several other dance genres, originated from Accra. Accra is also home to some beautiful sandy beaches. Tourism is thriving in Accra and the country as a whole.
In 2010, the Globalization and World Cities Research Network designated Accra a Gamma-minus-level world city, indicating a growing level of international influence and connectedness. Its entry into the internationally acclaimed MONOPOLY family underscores its unique status as an emerging tourism and business city.
The City of Accra Edition provides an exceptional city tour. It captures the rich diversity of the city’s exciting offerings and highlights the extent to which it has evolved over the past decade. You can now play this classic game with Accra’s street names and some of its most recognised landmarks. Savour a piece of the true magic that the City of Accra exudes, and experience its energy and pace. At the same time you will learn about Ghana from an architectural and historical point of view.
Find your favourite Accra hotspot, roll the dice and build your property empire from Nima to Ridge via Airport City in this special edition of this most famous board game. In 2013, the New York Times, named Accra as one of its top Travel destinations and listed it 4th on their “46 places to go in 2013”. The prestigious paper described the city as “a buzzing metropolis ready for business and pleasure”.
“Charley, welcome aboard!”
